sub_title: Virtual World Specialist & Founder at The Vesuvius Group, LLC
summary:
Jeroen is one of the three Founders of the Vesuvius Group, LLC, and functions as Executive Director and Virtual World Technology Specialist.

The Vesuvius Group is a Full Service Solution provider for companies and institutions who desire to develop a presence or experience in a virtual world, with expertise in the virtual world platform Second Life & OpenSim. 

Jeroen is a creative producer and futurist always looking forward to how innovative technology can be used and enhanced. This drives him to try his hand in many technologies, and his early adoption has resulted in a wide skill set in programing, 3D, Web and game design, machinima and animation.

You can reach me here: frans@thevesuviusgroup.com.

Specialties: Usability, HTML, LSL, PHP, Second Life, Virtual Worlds, Metaverse, Machinima

projects.title: Presenter at the Open Simulator Community Conference 2014
projects.description:
The OpenSimulator Community Conference is an annual conference that focuses on the developer and user community creating the OpenSimulator software.  Organized as a joint production by the Overte Foundation and AvaCon, Inc., the conference features two days of presentations, workshops, keynote sessions, and social events across diverse sectors of the OpenSimulator user base.

OpenSimulator is an open source multi-platform, multi-user 3D application server that can be used to create a virtual environment (or world) which can be accessed through a variety of clients, on multiple protocols. It also has an optional facility (the Hypergrid) to allow users to visit other OpenSimulator installations across the web from an account on a ‘home’ OpenSimulator installation.

projects.title: Avatar Artist in Residence - Crossworlds Virtual Gallery (Second Life Virtual World)
projects.description:
"BellaLuna X" (Real Life: Patty Rangel) began her journey as an Avatar in Second Life in 2007. Since then, she has explored numerous Sims, documented her journeys and collaborated in virtual and mixed-reality projects ranging from theater, live concerts, and business presentations to creating the world's first Holographic Telepresence System for Avatars (in 2010) on the top floor of the Crossworlds Gallery.

Bella's achievements in the virtual world/mixed-reality space have led to guest speaker engagements at NASA (with Philip Rosedale), at the Second Life National Community Conference, at the OpenSim Community Conference, and the Metaverse Cultural Series.

This is the first time BellaLuna X takes a step back from production and tech integration to present as an Artist under the Crossworlds Gallery umbrella, a very special place, dear and close to her heart.

About the "ETERNAL CONTEMPLATION" exhibit:
Mixed-Media and Virtual World Photography.

These are dreams presented through multiple layers of virtual environments, created by the community, and experienced by BellaLuna as a multi-dimensional state of contemplation and meditation.

Art Exhibition Opening photos, documented by The Vesuvius Group: https://www.flickr.com/photos/thevesuviusgroup/sets/72157651197240785

projects.title: BreakThru
projects.description:
BreakThru is an initiative sponsored by the Georgia STEM Accessibility Alliance (GSAA), a collaborative effort between the College of Education Learning and Performance Support Lab at the University of Georgia and the Center for Assistive Technology and Environmental Access (CATEA) at Georgia Institute of Technology. The GSAA is lead by Robert L. Todd of CATEA and Noel Gregg, Ph.D. of the College of Education Learning and Performance Support Lab and is funded by the National Science Foundation Research in Disabilities Education Program. The goals of this initiative are to increase student confidence and participation in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics) classes. BreakThru offers an environment in which students of all levels of ability can meet with mentors and receive the extra attention they need to excel in these courses.

BreakThru is a powerful learning community that connects students with disabilities and mentors in a unique way to promote universal learning and accessibility to Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) based degrees. BreakThru empowers our students with the opportunity to escape from the limitations and boundaries of the traditional classroom. BreakThru is a blended learning community that bridges the gap between the classroom and the virtual world to engage students in STEM based curriculums and resources.

projects.title: IDEAL-ITQ Helios Education Foundation
projects.description: IDEAL (Integrated Data to Enhance Arizona’s Learning) ITQ: Improving Teacher Quality is an initiative that is making teacher education materials accessible online to rural community teachers who cannot otherwise attend face-to-face workshops. Partnered with the Applied Learning Technologies Institute (alt^I) and funded by the Helios Education Foundation. Included creating a virtual Science learning environment and accompanying online collaborative tools with a goal of helping Arizona middle school science teachers become highly qualified teachers through problem based learning.

projects.title: Science Action Club - California Academy of Sciences
projects.description:
Developed an online learning and social sharing platform for grant funded youth citizen science program at the California Academy of Sciences in CA. The website serves as both an online social network for the middle schoolers, in addition to a platform for them to share their work. 

About the Science Action Club program:
At the start of 2011, the California Academy of Sciences received a grant from the S.D. Bechtel, Jr. Foundation to design, implement, and evaluate a new community science pilot program entitled Youth Centered Learning Through Community Science. Students selected to participate in the project form their own Science Action Club at their school.

profile_positions.description:
Co-founder, Executive Director, Virtual World Technology Specialist, responsible for project building & management of virtual world spaces within Second Life and other online platforms.

Skills/Experience includes:
- Texture creation
- 3D Design & building
- Event planning and hosting
- Scriptwriting, storyboarding, filming & editing machinima
- Scripting/programming of interactive objects
- Web intergration into SL (rss/database backend)

Projects/Clients include:
- Bumbershoot Arts Festival/Sudo sim
- Ramapo, NY school district
- Poser 7 launch event/e frontier software
- Morpheus Media, NYC, NY

The Vesuvius Group is a collective of idea conceptualizers and techy creatives working together in Second Life on collaborative projects that make a difference. Our team members come to this virtual space with real world experience as the foundation of the services we provide including project management, event planning, marketing, art direction, design, machinimatography, scripting, 3D building and texturing.

'Private Workspace', a build tool for within Second Life, is the most sold product on Slboutique.com

profile_positions.title: Virtual World Content producer

profile_positions.description:
A European conference addressing the present and future of user-created virtual worlds such as Second Life, Active Worlds, OpenSim and more.

World-wide citizens from virtual environments met in person at the conference as well as at our cross-media events. Our speakers cover a range of topics including business, education, non-profit organization and cultural projects. Our aim is to exchange information and experience with a common goal. We are offering our conference participants the opportunity to build bridges among diverse virtual worlds. We welcome those keen upon illustrating the time-saving, cost-reducing and community engagement benefits.
